ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.2_0: the monks from the group of six hit the monks from the group of seventeen in anger.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.4_0: When other monks asked him why,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.6_0: and they told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six hit other monks in anger?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk hits a monk in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.8_0: Among a person whose mind is overcome and overwhelmed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.10_0: if he hits with his body, with anything connected to his body, or with anything released, even if only with a lotus leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.1_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.2_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.3_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.4_0: If he hits one who is not fully ordained in anger, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.5_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.6_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.7_0: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.3.5_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on hitting, is finished.
